# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is the solution:
```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [DateTime(string(d.year), string(d.month)) for d in df[:dt]]
end

# Test on a provided data frame
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This code defines a function `add_yearmonth` that takes a DataFrame and adds a new column "ym" which represents the year and month of each datetime in the format specified. The function loops through each DateTime in the df[:dt] array, extracts the year and month components using the .year and .month methods respectively, and then converts these to strings with string() method. These are then concatenated into a single string with DateTime constructor. This new column is added to the DataFrame.

The test on the provided DataFrame adds this new "ym" column and displays the resulting dataframe.
